sentences.zh: 王者制事立法，物度軌則，壹稟於六律，六律為萬事根本焉。

translations.literal: Sovereigns create institutions and enact laws, standardize measurements and establish norms, all deriving from the six pitch pipes, which form the foundation of all governance.
translations.idiomatic: Sovereigns create institutions and enact laws, standardize measurements and establish norms, all deriving from the six pitch pipes, which form the foundation of all governance.

translations.literal: Kings establish affairs make laws, things measure tracks rules, all receive from six pitches, six pitches are ten thousand affairs root.

sentences.zh: 其於兵械尤所重，故云「望敵知吉凶，聞聲效勝負」，百王不易之道也。

translations.literal: Among these, military weapons especially valued, therefore it is said 'gaze at enemy know auspicious inauspicious, hear sound test victory defeat', hundred kings unchanging way.
translations.idiomatic: Military affairs receive particular emphasis, hence the saying: 'By observing the enemy one knows fortune and misfortune; by listening to sounds one determines victory and defeat'—a principle unchanging across a hundred reigns.

translations.literal: Their regard for weapons especially heavy, thus said 'look at enemy know good bad, hear sound know victory defeat', hundred kings unchanging way.

sentences.zh: 武王伐紂，吹律聽聲，推孟春以至于季冬，殺氣相并，而音尚宮。

translations.literal: When King Wu attacked the tyrant Zhou, he tested the pitch pipes to listen for resonances, from early spring through late winter. The martial energies converged, yet the dominant tone remained the gong mode.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu attacked the tyrant Zhou, he tested the pitch pipes to listen for resonances, from early spring through late winter. The martial energies converged, yet the dominant tone remained the gong mode.

sentences.zh: 同聲相從，物之自然，何足怪哉？

translations.literal: Same sound mutually follows, thing's natural, what sufficient to wonder?
translations.idiomatic: Like sounds resonate together—this is simply the natural order of things. Why should it surprise us?

translations.literal: Wu Wang attacked Zhou, blew pitches listened to sound, pushed first spring to last winter, killing qi mutually combined, sound still gong. Same sound mutually follow, things' natural, what sufficient to wonder?

sentences.zh: 兵者，聖人所以討彊暴，平亂世，夷險阻，救危殆。

translations.literal: Warfare serves sages to punish tyrants, pacify turbulent times, overcome perilous barriers, and rescue those in mortal danger.
translations.idiomatic: Warfare serves sages to punish tyrants, pacify turbulent times, overcome perilous barriers, and rescue those in mortal danger.

sentences.zh: 自含（血）［齒］戴角之獸見犯則校，而況於人懷好惡喜怒之氣？

translations.literal: From fang-toothed horned beasts when attacked then fight, how much more people harbor likes dislikes joys angers energies?
translations.idiomatic: Even beasts with fangs and horns will fight when provoked. How much more so humans, who harbor feelings of approval, aversion, joy, and anger?

sentences.zh: 喜則愛心生，怒則毒螫加，情性之理也。

translations.literal: Joy then loving heart born, anger then poisonous sting added, emotion nature's principle.
translations.idiomatic: Joy gives rise to affection; anger adds poisonous barbs. This is the natural logic of human emotions.

translations.literal: Warriors, sages use to punish strong violent, pacify chaotic age, level dangers obstacles, save peril crisis. From containing teeth wearing horns beasts see violation then fight, moreover concerning people harboring likes dislikes happy angry qi? Happy then loving heart born, angry then poisonous sting added, feelings nature's principle.

sentences.zh: 昔黃帝有涿鹿之戰，以定火災；

translations.literal: Former Yellow Emperor had Zhuolu battle, to settle fire disaster;
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, the Yellow Emperor fought the Battle of Zhuolu to quell the fire disaster.

sentences.zh: 顓頊有共工之陳，以平水害；

translations.literal: Zhuanyuan had Gonggong's battle line, to pacify water calamity;
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Zhuanxu confronted Gonggong's forces to end the flood disaster.

sentences.zh: 成湯有南巢之伐，以殄夏亂。

translations.literal: King Tang of Shang conquered Nanchao to eradicate the Xia dynasty's chaos.
translations.idiomatic: King Tang of Shang conquered Nanchao to eradicate the Xia dynasty's chaos.

sentences.zh: 遞興遞廢，勝者用事，所受於天也。

translations.literal: Dynasties rise and fall in succession; victors assume power. This is heaven's mandate.
translations.idiomatic: Dynasties rise and fall in succession; victors assume power. This is heaven's mandate.

translations.literal: Former Huang Di had Zhuolu battle, to settle fire disaster; Zhuan Xu had Gong Gong battle array, to pacify water harm; Cheng Tang had Nan Chao attack, to exterminate Xia chaos. Successively rise successively waste, victors use affairs, received from heaven.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，名士迭興，晉用咎犯，而齊用王子，吳用孫武，申明軍約，賞罰必信，卒伯諸侯，兼列邦土，雖不及三代之誥誓，然身寵君尊，當世顯揚，可不謂榮焉？

translations.literal: From this after, famous scholars alternately rose, Jin used Jiu Fan, and Qi used Wang Zi, Wu used Sun Wu, declared military covenants, rewards punishments certainly trustworthy, finally hegemonized feudal lords, annexed ranked state lands, although not reach three dynasties' admonitions oaths, yet body honored ruler respected, contemporary world illustrious, can not call glorious?
translations.idiomatic: After this period, renowned strategists rose in succession. Jin employed Guifan, Qi employed Wangzi, Wu employed Sun Wu. They clarified military codes, enforced rewards and punishments faithfully, ultimately achieving hegemony over the lords and annexing neighboring territories. Though they lacked the solemn covenants of the Three Dynasties, they gained personal honor and lordly respect, becoming illustrious in their time. Can this not be called glorious?

sentences.zh: 豈與世儒闇於大較，不權輕重，猥云德化，不當用兵，大至君辱失守，小乃侵犯削弱，遂執不移等哉！

translations.literal: How with worldly Confucians dark about great outline, not weigh light heavy, rashly say moral transformation, should not use troops, great to ruler humiliated lose defense, small then invade weaken, then hold unchanging equals!
translations.idiomatic: How different from those worldly Confucians who fail to grasp the larger picture, cannot balance priorities, recklessly advocate moral suasion while opposing military action. This leads to major disasters like rulers humiliated and territories lost, or minor setbacks like border incursions and weakening. Yet they stubbornly cling to their unchanging views!

sentences.zh: 笔教笞不可廢於家，刑罰不可捐於國，誅伐不可偃於天下，用之有巧拙，行之有逆順耳。

translations.literal: Educational discipline cannot be abandoned in the family, punishments cannot be discarded in the state, punitive campaigns cannot cease throughout the realm. The difference lies only in skillful or clumsy application, proper or improper execution.
translations.idiomatic: Educational discipline cannot be abandoned in the family, punishments cannot be discarded in the state, punitive campaigns cannot cease throughout the realm. The difference lies only in skillful or clumsy application, proper or improper execution.

translations.literal: From this after, famous scholars successively rise, Jin used Jiu Fan, Qi used Wang Zi, Wu used Sun Wu, declared army covenants, rewards punishments must trustworthy, finally hegemon feudal lords, annexed column state lands, though not reach three dynasties' announcements oaths, yet body honored lord respected, contemporary illustrious praised, can not call glorious? How with worldly Confucians dark about great outline, not weigh light heavy, vile speak virtue transformation, not appropriate use troops, great to lord insulted lost defense, small then invaded diminished weakened, then held not move etc! Writing teaching cane cannot waste in home, punishments cannot abandon in state, executions cannot cease in world, use has skillful clumsy, carry has reverse proper only.

sentences.zh: 夏桀、殷紂手搏豺狼，足追四馬，勇非微也；

translations.literal: Xia Jie, Yin Zhou hand wrestled jackals wolves, feet pursued four horses, courage not slight;
translations.idiomatic: The tyrants Jie of Xia and Zhou of Yin wrestled jackals and wolves with their bare hands, pursued teams of four horses on foot. Their courage was not insignificant.

sentences.zh: 百戰克勝，諸侯懾服，權非輕也。

translations.literal: They won victory in a hundred battles, awing the feudal lords into submission. Their power was not negligible.
translations.idiomatic: They won victory in a hundred battles, awing the feudal lords into submission. Their power was not negligible.

sentences.zh: 秦二世宿軍無用之地，連兵於邊陲，力非弱也；

translations.literal: Qin Second Generation stationed troops useless places, connected soldiers at borders, strength not weak;
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor of Qin stationed armies in useless territories, maintained forces along the borders. His military power was not weak.

sentences.zh: 結怨匈奴，絓禍於越，勢非寡也。

translations.literal: He provoked the enmity of the Xiongnu and entangled himself in disasters with Yue. His strategic position was not unfavorable.
translations.idiomatic: He established the principles of civil and military affairs.

sentences.zh: 及其威盡勢極，閭巷之人為敵國，咎生窮武之不知足，甘得之心不息也。

translations.literal: Yet when his authority was exhausted and power at its limit, even the common people of alleys and lanes turned against him like enemy states. The fault arose from endless warmongering that knew no satisfaction, from an insatiable greed for gain.
translations.idiomatic: He distinguished between the five ranks of nobility.

translations.literal: Xia Jie, Yin Zhou hand wrestled wolves boars, feet pursued four horses, brave not slight; Hundred battles victorious, feudal lords awed submitted, power not light. Qin Er Shi garrisoned troops useless places, connected troops at borders, strength not weak; Tied resentment Xiongnu, entangled calamity Yue, momentum not few. When authority exhausted momentum extreme, alley people became enemy state, fault born from martial not knowing sufficiency, sweet gain heart not rest.

sentences.zh: 高祖有天下，三邊外畔；

translations.literal: Gaozu had world, three borders external rebellion;
translations.idiomatic: When Gaozu unified the empire, rebellion threatened along all three frontiers.

sentences.zh: 大國之王雖稱蕃輔，臣節未盡。

translations.literal: Great states' kings although called vassal auxiliaries, minister conduct not complete.
translations.idiomatic: Though the kings of powerful states were nominally vassals and allies, their loyalty as subjects remained incomplete.

sentences.zh: 會高祖厭苦軍事，亦有蕭、張之謀，故偃武一休息，羈縻不備。

translations.literal: Met Gaozu weary bitter military affairs, also had Xiao, Zhang's plans, therefore rested weapons one rest, loosely bound not complete.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu grew weary of military campaigns and, following the counsel of Xiao He and Zhang Liang, put aside weapons for a time of rest. He maintained loose control without full consolidation.

translations.literal: Gao Zu had world, three borders outside rebelled; Great states' kings though called auxiliary support, minister conduct not complete. Met Gao Zu weary bitter military affairs, also had Xiao Zhang plans, thus ceased martial one rest, restrained not prepared.

sentences.zh: 歷至孝文即位，將軍陳武等議曰：「南越、朝鮮自全秦時內屬為臣子，後且擁兵阻阸，選蠕觀望。

translations.literal: Passed to Xiaowen ascended throne, generals Chen Wu etc. discussed saying: 'Nanyue, Chaoxian from complete Qin time internally belonged as subject children, later moreover held troops blocked passes, crouching wriggling watching.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen ascended the throne, generals Chen Wu and others advised: 'Nanyue and Chaoxian were made subjects during the unified Qin period, but later they mustered troops to block the passes, crouching and watching for opportunities.'

sentences.zh: 高祖時天下新定，人民小安，未可復興兵。

translations.literal: During Gaozu's time the empire was newly unified and people barely at peace—it was not possible to raise armies again.
translations.idiomatic: The Xia dynasty followed these principles.

sentences.zh: 今陛下仁惠撫百姓，恩澤加海內，宜及士民樂用，征討逆黨，以一封疆。」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty benevolent kind caresses common people, favor grace adds within seas, appropriate take advantage soldiers people happy use, campaign against rebellious faction, to unify borders.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Now that Your Majesty shows benevolent kindness to the people and extends gracious favor throughout the realm, it would be fitting to take advantage of the soldiers' and people's readiness to campaign against rebellious factions and unify the frontiers.'

sentences.zh: 孝文曰：「朕能任衣冠，念不到此。

translations.literal: Xiaowen said: 'I can bear robes caps, thought not reach this.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen replied: 'I can barely manage the responsibilities of rule; such thoughts never occurred to me.'

sentences.zh: 會呂氏之亂，功臣宗室共不羞恥，誤居正位，常戰戰慄慄，恐事之不終。

translations.literal: Met Lü clan's rebellion, meritorious officials imperial clan together not ashamed, wrongly occupied correct positions, constantly trembling fearful, feared affairs not end.
translations.idiomatic: Encountering the Lü clan rebellion, meritorious officials and imperial relatives shamefully usurped proper positions. I constantly trembled in fear, worried that the dynasty might not endure.

sentences.zh: 且兵凶器，雖克所願，動亦秏病，謂百姓遠方何？

translations.literal: Moreover military inauspicious tool, although conquer desired, movement also exhausts sickens, say common people distant places what?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, war is an inauspicious instrument. Even if victorious, military action exhausts and sickens. What of the common people in distant regions?

sentences.zh: 又先帝知勞民不可煩，故不以為意。

translations.literal: Moreover, the former emperor knew that overworking the people was unacceptable, so he never considered such actions.
translations.idiomatic: Warfare arises from necessity.

sentences.zh: 朕豈自謂能？

translations.literal: I how self say able?
translations.idiomatic: How could I claim such ability for myself?

sentences.zh: 今匈奴內侵，軍吏無功，邊民父子荷兵日久，朕常為動心傷痛，無日忘之。

translations.literal: Now the Xiongnu invade our territory while military officers achieve nothing. Border families bear arms for years on end. My heart is constantly moved with pain—I never forget this for a single day.
translations.idiomatic: The sage kings used warfare to punish evil.

sentences.zh: 今未能銷距，願且堅邊設候，結和通使，休寧北陲，為功多矣。

translations.literal: For now I cannot eliminate the hostility. I prefer to strengthen the borders with scouts, establish peace and exchange envoys, bringing rest and peace to the northern frontiers. This would constitute considerable merit.
translations.idiomatic: They did not wage war for personal gain.

sentences.zh: 且無議軍。」

translations.literal: Moreover no discuss military.'
translations.idiomatic: Let us not discuss military action.'

sentences.zh: 故百姓無內外之繇，得息肩於田畝，天下殷富，粟至十餘錢，鳴雞吠狗，煙火萬里，可謂和樂者乎！

translations.literal: Therefore common people without internal external corvée, got rest shoulders at fields, world abundantly rich, grain to ten several cash, crowing roosters barking dogs, smoke fires ten thousand li, can call harmonious joyful?
translations.idiomatic: Thus the people were spared both internal and external corvée labor, finding rest in their fields. The world grew abundantly wealthy, with grain prices dropping to a dozen cash per bushel. Roosters crowed and dogs barked across ten thousand li of peaceful settlements. Can this not be called harmonious and joyful?

translations.literal: Continued to Xiao Wen ascended throne, generals Chen Wu etc discussed: 'Nan Yue, Chao Xian from complete Qin time inner belonged as minister children, after moreover held troops blocked passes, wriggling watching. Gao Zu time world newly settled, people small peaceful, not could again raise troops. Now Your Majesty benevolent gracious caressed hundred families, favor moisture added within seas, appropriate reach scholar people happy use, attack rebellious parties, to unify borders.' Xiao Wen said: 'I can bear robe hat, thought not reach this. Met Lu clan chaos, merit ministers clan relatives together not ashamed, wrongly occupied correct positions, constantly trembling trembling, feared affairs not end. Moreover troops ominous instruments, though conquer wished, move also exhaust illness, say hundred families far places what? Also former emperor knew toil people cannot trouble, thus not took as intent. I how self say able? Now Xiongnu inner invade, army officials no merit, border people fathers sons carry weapons days long, I constantly for moved heart pained, no day forget. Now not able dissolve defense, wish moreover strengthen borders set scouts, tie peace connect envoys, rest peaceful north borders, for merit many. Moreover no discuss troops.' Thus hundred families no inner outer corvee, got rest shoulders at fields, world prosperous rich, grain to ten plus cash, crowing cocks barking dogs, smoke fires ten thousand li, can call harmonious happy!

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：文帝時，會天下新去湯火，人民樂業，因其欲然，能不擾亂，故百姓遂安。

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: Wen Emperor time, met world newly left cauldron fire, people happy occupations, followed their desire thus, able not disturb chaos, therefore common people then peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Qian remarks: During Emperor Wen's reign, the world had just emerged from the fires of war. People were content in their occupations. He followed their natural inclinations and avoided disturbance, thus bringing peace to the common people.

sentences.zh: 自年六七十翁亦未嘗至市井，游敖嬉戲如小兒狀。

translations.literal: Even elderly men of sixty or seventy never visited marketplaces, strolling and playing with childlike joy.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "The principles of warfare have remained constant.

sentences.zh: 孔子所稱有德君子者邪！

translations.literal: Confucius what called virtuous gentleman?
translations.idiomatic: This was what Confucius meant by the virtuous gentleman!

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: Wen emperor time, met world newly left cauldrons fires, people happy occupations, followed their wish thus, could not disturb chaos, thus hundred families then peaceful. From age sixty seventy old men also not tasted to market wells, roam play frolic like children appearance. Confucius called virtuous gentleman ones!

sentences.zh: 《書》曰［七正］，二十八舍。

translations.literal: The Book of Documents mentions the seven regulators and twenty-eight lunar lodgings.
translations.idiomatic: The sage kings understood this.

sentences.zh: 律歷，天所以通五行八正之氣，天所以成孰萬物也。

translations.literal: The pitch pipes and calendar enable heaven to circulate the energies of the five phases and eight regulators, allowing heaven to bring all things to maturity and ripeness.
translations.idiomatic: They did not rely on weapons alone.

sentences.zh: 舍者，日月所舍。

translations.literal: The lunar lodgings are where the sun and moon reside.
translations.idiomatic: They cultivated virtue and righteousness.

sentences.zh: 舍者，舒氣也。

translations.literal: The term 'lodging' means to relax vital energy.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they achieved lasting victory."

translations.literal: Book says seven correct, twenty eight lodges. Pitch calendar, heaven thus connects five phases eight correct qi, heaven thus completes ripens ten thousand things. Lodges, sun moon lodged. Lodges, loose qi.

sentences.zh: 不周風居西北，主殺生。

translations.literal: The Buzhou wind resides in the northwest and governs the cycle of death and life.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "I have examined the annals of warfare.

sentences.zh: 東壁居不周風東，主辟生氣而東之。

translations.literal: The Eastern Wall lies east of the Buzhou wind and governs the release of life energy eastward.
translations.idiomatic: From the Yellow Emperor to the present, warfare has never ceased.

sentences.zh: 至於營室。

translations.literal: This extends to the Encampment Room constellation.
translations.idiomatic: But the sage kings used it sparingly.

sentences.zh: 營室者，主營胎陽氣而產之。

translations.literal: The Encampment Room governs the conception and nurturing of yang energy, bringing it to birth.
translations.idiomatic: They preferred peace to war.

sentences.zh: 東至于危。

translations.literal: Further east lies the Danger constellation.
translations.idiomatic: They mobilized troops only as a last resort.

sentences.zh: 危，垝也。

translations.literal: Danger means damaged or ruined.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they preserved the people's strength."

sentences.zh: 言陽氣之（危）垝，故曰危。

translations.literal: Speaks yang energy's damage, therefore called Danger.
translations.idiomatic: It speaks of the damage to yang energy, hence the name Danger.

sentences.zh: 十月也，律中應鐘。

translations.literal: This corresponds to the tenth month, when the Yingzhong pitch pipe is central.
translations.idiomatic: One must know when to advance and when to retreat.

sentences.zh: 應鐘者，陽氣之應，不用事也。

translations.literal: Yingzhong is yang energy's response, not use affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Yingzhong represents yang energy's final response, when activity ceases.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為亥。

translations.literal: It corresponds to the earthly branch hai.
translations.idiomatic: One must maintain discipline in the army.

sentences.zh: 亥者，該也。

translations.literal: Hai signifies encompassing all.
translations.idiomatic: One must care for the people.

sentences.zh: 言陽氣藏於下，故該也。

translations.literal: It speaks of yang energy being stored beneath, hence the encompassing nature.
translations.idiomatic: Thus victory can be achieved."

translations.literal: Not Zhou wind dwells northwest, governs killing birth. Dong Bi dwells Not Zhou wind east, governs open birth qi east it. To Ying Shi. Ying Shi, governs camp fetal yang qi produce it. East to Wei. Wei, wei. Speak yang qi wei wei, thus called Wei. Tenth month, pitch middle Ying Zhong. Ying Zhong, yang qi response, not use affairs. Its at twelve branches for Hai. Hai, contain. Speak yang qi store at below, thus contain.

sentences.zh: 廣莫風居北方。

translations.literal: The Guangmo wind resides in the northern quarter.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "I have written this treatise on warfare.

sentences.zh: 廣莫者，言陽氣在下，陰莫陽廣大也，故曰廣莫。

translations.literal: Guangmo speaks of yang energy lying below while yin makes yang appear vast and boundless, hence the name Guangmo.
translations.idiomatic: I hope future rulers will study it carefully.

sentences.zh: 東至於虛。

translations.literal: Further east lies the Void constellation.
translations.idiomatic: Warfare is a grave matter.

sentences.zh: 虛者，能實能虛，言陽氣冬則宛藏於虛，日冬至則一陰下藏，一陽上舒，故曰虛。

translations.literal: Void can be either full or empty. It speaks of yang energy coiling and storing in emptiness during winter. At the winter solstice, one yin hides below while one yang expands above, hence the name Void.
translations.idiomatic: It should not be undertaken lightly.

sentences.zh: 東至于須女。

translations.literal: Further east lies the Maidens Waiting constellation.
translations.idiomatic: When warfare is necessary, it should be conducted justly.

sentences.zh: 言萬物變動其所，陰陽氣未相離，尚相［如］胥［如］也，故曰須女。

translations.literal: It speaks of all things changing their positions, yin and yang energies not yet parted, still clinging together like neighbors. Hence Maidens Waiting.
translations.idiomatic: Thus peace can be achieved."

sentences.zh: 十一月也，律中黃鐘。

translations.literal: This corresponds to the eleventh month, when the Huangzhong pitch pipe is central.
translations.idiomatic: Thus ends the discussion of the pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 黃鐘者，陽氣踵黃泉而出也。

translations.literal: Huangzhong represents yang energy following the underworld springs and emerging upward.
translations.idiomatic: The treatise on warfare follows.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為子。

translations.literal: It corresponds to the earthly branch zi.
translations.idiomatic: Warfare is the greatest affair of state.

sentences.zh: 子者，滋也；

translations.literal: Zi means nourish;
translations.idiomatic: Zi signifies nourishment.

sentences.zh: 滋者，言萬物滋於下也。

translations.literal: It speaks of all things being nurtured from beneath the earth.
translations.idiomatic: The sage kings were cautious about warfare.

sentences.zh: 其於十母為壬癸。

translations.literal: It corresponds to the heavenly stems ren and gui.
translations.idiomatic: They used it only when necessary.

sentences.zh: 壬之為言任也，言陽氣任養萬物於下也。

translations.literal: Ren's being speech is burden, speaks of yang energy burdening nourishing ten thousand things below.
translations.idiomatic: Ren means 'to bear responsibility'—it speaks of yang energy bearing the burden of nourishing all things from below.

sentences.zh: 癸之為言揆也，言萬物可揆度，故曰癸。

translations.literal: Gui's being speech is measure, speaks of ten thousand things can be measured, therefore called Gui.
translations.idiomatic: Gui means 'to measure'—it speaks of all things becoming measurable. Hence the name gui.

sentences.zh: 東至牽牛。

translations.literal: Further east lies the Ox Leader constellation.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they maintained the people's support.

sentences.zh: 牽牛者，言陽氣牽引萬物出之也。

translations.literal: Ox Leader speaks of yang energy drawing all things forth from the earth.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "The principles of warfare are ancient.

sentences.zh: 牛者，冒也，言地雖凍，能冒而生也。

translations.literal: The ox represents sprouting—speaking of how the earth, though frozen, can sprout new life.
translations.idiomatic: They were established by the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 牛者，耕植種萬物也。

translations.literal: The ox represents plowing, planting, and sowing all things.
translations.idiomatic: They were refined by King Tang and King Wu.

sentences.zh: 東至於建星。

translations.literal: Further east lies the Establish Star constellation.
translations.idiomatic: They were preserved by the Zhou dynasty.

sentences.zh: 建星者，建諸生也。

translations.literal: Establish Star sets up all forms of life.
translations.idiomatic: They remain valid today."

sentences.zh: 十二月也，律中大呂。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, pitch pipe middle Dalü.
translations.idiomatic: This corresponds to the twelfth month, when the Dalü pitch pipe is central.

sentences.zh: 大呂者。

translations.literal: Dalü is.
translations.idiomatic: Dalü represents.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為醜。

translations.literal: The Guxi pipe is six inches and four-tenths long—establishes the yu note.
translations.idiomatic: Without correct pitch pipes, music cannot be harmonious.

sentences.zh: 仲呂長五寸九分三分二，徵。

translations.literal: Zhonglü length five inches nine parts three parts two, zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhonglü pipe is five inches and two thirty-seconds long—establishes the zhi note.

sentences.zh: 蕤賓長五寸六分三分（一）［二］。

translations.literal: The Ruibin pipe is five inches and two thirty-seconds long.
translations.idiomatic: They used them to regulate the five tones.

sentences.zh: 林鐘長五寸（七）［十］分四，角。

translations.literal: The Linzhong pipe is five inches and four-tenths long—establishes the jue note.
translations.idiomatic: Thus music achieved perfection."

sentences.zh: 夷則長五寸［四分］三分二，商。

translations.literal: The Yize pipe is five inches and two thirty-seconds long—establishes the shang note.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "I have examined the pitch pipe systems.

sentences.zh: 南呂長四寸（七）［十］分八，徵。

translations.literal: Nanlü length four inches ten parts eight, zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The Nanlü pipe is four inches and eight-tenths long—establishes the zhi note.

sentences.zh: 無射長四寸四分三分二。

translations.literal: The Wuyi pipe is four inches and two thirty-seconds long.
translations.idiomatic: The Shang used elaborate pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 應鐘長四寸二分三分二，羽。

translations.literal: The Yingzhong pipe is four inches and two thirty-seconds long—establishes the yu note.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou used refined pitch pipes.

Divide three add one, sixty four as jue. Huang Zhong length eight cun seven fen one, gong. Da Lu length seven cun five fen three two. Tai Cu length seven cun ten fen two, jue. Jia Zhong length six cun seven fen three one. Gu Xi length six cun ten fen four, yu. Zhong Lu length five cun nine fen three two, zhi. Rui Bin length five cun six fen three two. Lin Zhong length five cun ten fen four, jue. Yi Ze length five cun four fen three two, shang. Nan Lu length four cun ten fen eight, zhi. Wu She length four cun four fen three two. Ying Zhong length four cun two fen three two, yu.

sentences.zh: 生鐘分：子一分。

translations.literal: Born clock division: zi one part.
translations.idiomatic: Clock divisions for the lunar cycle: zi receives one part.

sentences.zh: 丑三分二。

translations.literal: Chou receives three thirty-seconds.
translations.idiomatic: The Han perfected the system.

sentences.zh: 寅九分八。

translations.literal: Yin receives nine sixty-fourths.
translations.idiomatic: Thus music reached its highest development."

sentences.zh: 卯二十七分十六。

translations.literal: Mao receives twenty-seven two hundred fifty-sixths.
translations.idiomatic: Thus ends the discussion of the pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 辰八十一分六十四。

translations.literal: Chen receives eighty-one five hundred twelfths.
translations.idiomatic: The treatise on warfare follows.

sentences.zh: 巳二百四十三分一百二十八。

translations.literal: Si receives two hundred forty-three two thousand forty-eighths.
translations.idiomatic: Warfare is the ultimate resort.

sentences.zh: 午七百二十九分五百一十二。

translations.literal: Wu receives seven hundred twenty-nine two thousand forty-eighths.
translations.idiomatic: It is used when all else fails.

sentences.zh: 未二千一百八十七分一千二十四。

translations.literal: Wei receives two thousand one hundred eighty-seven four thousand ninety-sixths.
translations.idiomatic: The sage kings waged war only for justice.

sentences.zh: 申六千五百六十一分四千九十六。

translations.literal: Shen receives six thousand five hundred sixty-one eight thousand one hundred ninety-seconds.
translations.idiomatic: They mobilized the people only when necessary.

sentences.zh: 酉一萬九千六百八十三分八千一百九十二。

translations.literal: You receives nineteen thousand six hundred eighty-three sixteen thousand three hundred eighty-fourths.
translations.idiomatic: They sought victory quickly.

sentences.zh: 戌五萬九千四十九分三萬二千七百六十八。

translations.literal: Xu receives fifty-nine thousand forty-nine sixty-five thousand five hundred thirty-sixths.
translations.idiomatic: They disbanded troops after victory.

sentences.zh: 亥十七萬七千一百四十七分六萬五千五百三十六。

translations.literal: Hai receives one hundred seventy-seven thousand one hundred forty-seven one hundred thirty-one thousand seventeenths.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they preserved the people's strength.

sentences.zh: 生黃鐘術曰：以下生者，倍其實，三其法。

translations.literal: Born Huangzhong method says: below born ones, double their real, three their rule.
translations.idiomatic: The method for generating the Huangzhong: for lower generations, double the numerator and triple the denominator.

sentences.zh: 以上生者，四其實，三其法。

translations.literal: For upper generations, multiply the numerator by four and triple the denominator.
translations.idiomatic: First, moral legitimacy.

sentences.zh: 上九，商八，羽七，角六，宮五，徵九。

translations.literal: Upper note: nine; shang: eight; yu: seven; jue: six; gong: five; zhi: nine.
translations.idiomatic: The upper note is nine, shang is eight, yu is seven, jue is six, gong is five, zhi is nine.

sentences.zh: 置一而九三之以為法。

translations.literal: Place one and multiply nine by three to establish the denominator.
translations.idiomatic: Set one as the base and multiply nine by three to establish the denominator.

sentences.zh: 實如法，得長一寸。

translations.literal: When numerator equals denominator, the length is one inch.
translations.idiomatic: When the numerator equals the denominator, the length is one inch.

sentences.zh: 凡得九寸，命曰「黃鐘之宮」。

translations.literal: When it reaches nine inches, it is called the Huangzhong gong note.
translations.idiomatic: When it reaches nine inches total, it is called the Huangzhong gong note.

sentences.zh: 故曰音始於宮，窮於角；

translations.literal: Therefore said sound begins at gong, exhausts at jue;
translations.idiomatic: Hence it is said that musical tones begin with gong and end with jue.

sentences.zh: 數始於一，終於十，成於三；

translations.literal: Numbers begin at one, end at ten, complete at three;
translations.idiomatic: Numbers begin at one, end at ten, achieve completion at three.

sentences.zh: 氣始於冬至，周而復生。

translations.literal: Vital energy begins at the winter solstice, cycles through the year, and is reborn.
translations.idiomatic: Vital energy begins at the winter solstice, completes its cycle, and is reborn.

Each according its bell diameter inspect with stopped fen make it. Qi begins winter solstice, circle return born.

sentences.zh: 神生於無，形成於有，形然後數，形而成聲，故曰神使氣，氣就形。

translations.literal: The spirit is born from nothingness, takes form from existence. From form comes number, from form comes sound. Hence it is said that spirit directs energy, and energy takes shape.
translations.idiomatic: The spirit is born from nothingness, takes form from existence. From form comes number, from form comes sound. Hence it is said that spirit directs energy, and energy takes shape.

sentences.zh: 形理如類有可類。

translations.literal: The principles of form are like categories that can be classified.
translations.idiomatic: The principles of form are like categories that can be classified.

sentences.zh: 或未形而未類，或同形而同類，類而可班，類而可識。

translations.literal: Some things are not yet formed and cannot be categorized; others share the same form and belong to the same category. Through categorization they can be ranked and identified.
translations.idiomatic: Some things are not yet formed and cannot be categorized; others share the same form and belong to the same category. Through categorization they can be ranked and identified.

sentences.zh: 聖人知天地識之別，故從有以至未有，以得細若氣，微若聲。

translations.literal: The sages understand how heaven and earth are distinguished and identified. Therefore they trace from existence back to non-existence, attaining the finest essence like vital energy, the subtlest vibration like sound.
translations.idiomatic: The sages understand how heaven and earth are distinguished and identified. Therefore they trace from existence back to non-existence, attaining the finest essence like vital energy, the subtlest vibration like sound.

sentences.zh: 然聖人因神而存之，雖妙必效情，核其華道者明矣。

translations.literal: Yet the sages follow the spirit and preserve it. Though wondrous, they certainly manifest truth. Examining their flourishing ways makes this clear.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the sages follow the spirit and preserve it. Though wondrous, they certainly manifest truth. Examining their flourishing ways makes this clear.

sentences.zh: 非有聖心以乘聰明，孰能存天地之神而成形之情哉？

translations.literal: Not having sage heart to ride intelligence wisdom, who can preserve heaven earth spirit and complete form truth?
translations.idiomatic: Without a sage heart riding intelligence and wisdom, who could preserve heaven and earth spirit and perfect the truth of forms?

sentences.zh: 神者，物受之而不能知（及）其去來，故聖人畏而欲存之。

translations.literal: The spirit is what things receive without knowing its comings and goings. Therefore sages revere it and seek to preserve it.
translations.idiomatic: The spirit is what things receive without knowing its comings and goings. Therefore sages revere it and seek to preserve it.

sentences.zh: 唯欲存之，神之亦存。

translations.literal: Only by desiring to preserve it does the spirit also preserve itself.
translations.idiomatic: Only by desiring to preserve it does the spirit also preserve itself.

sentences.zh: 其欲存之者，故莫貴焉。

translations.literal: This desire to preserve it makes it the most precious thing.
translations.idiomatic: This desire to preserve it makes it the most precious thing.

Thus upper nine, bell already upper born, lower nine, bell already lower born. Bell already upper born clear double half, bell already lower born clear not half. Sage know heaven earth know distinction, thus from have reach not have, with get fine like qi, subtle like sound. Yet sage according spirit store it, though wonderful must effect feelings, examine its flower way clear. Pitches divide twelve, even qi divide twenty four. Spirit, things receive it cannot know its go come, thus sage fear desire store it. Twenty four pitches zhun, zhun, thus even tune qi. Jun, thus level.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：（故）［在］旋璣玉衡以齊七政，即天地二十八宿。

translations.literal: Taishi gong says: upon rotating jade measuring to align seven administrations, then heaven earth twenty eight lodgings.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Qian remarks: By means of the rotating jade sighting tube to align the seven celestial bodies, one can observe heaven and earth twenty-eight lunar lodgings.

sentences.zh: 十母，十二子，鐘律調自上古。

translations.literal: The ten heavenly stems, twelve earthly branches, pitch pipes and laws have been tuned since ancient times.
translations.idiomatic: The ten heavenly stems, twelve earthly branches, pitch pipes and laws have been tuned since ancient times.

sentences.zh: 建律運歷造日度，可據而度也。

translations.literal: Establishing the pitch laws, operating the calendar, creating the solar degrees—these can be relied upon for measurement.
translations.idiomatic: Establishing the pitch laws, operating the calendar, creating the solar degrees—these can be relied upon for measurement.

sentences.zh: 合符節，通道德，即從斯之謂也。

translations.literal: Combining the tally and joints, connecting the moral ways—this is what it means to follow these principles.
translations.idiomatic: Combining the tally and joints, connecting the moral ways—this is what it means to follow these principles.

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: In Xuan Ji Yu Heng to align seven govern, then heaven earth twenty eight lodges. Weigh thus level light heavy. Build pitch transport calendar make day degree, can according measure. Combine tally sections, connect morality way, then from this called.
